msDesc.head: Conradus de Brundelsheim, Sermons; theological treatises; Germany, 14th century, end

physDesc.p: Two parts: fols. 1–153, 154–207, together at an uncertain date; the summaries of contents on fols. 1r, 154r seem to be in the same (early fifteenth century?) hand.

binding.p: Reversed calf over laminated pulpboard for Abp. Laud, 1637–1639.
Traces of earlier bindings are visible on fols. 153 (part 1) and 207 (part 2, mark of a chain-staple in the top centre of the leaf).

history.provenance: Rejected by Mairhorfer as a Mainz manuscript.
On fol. 153v is added a quote from Ps.-Bernard, Meditationes piissimae, apparently dated 'nonas maiias' 1508.
history.acquisition: Part of his third donation to the Bodleian, 1639.

recordHist.source: Description by Tuija Ainonen and Matthew Holford (June 2020). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885 ). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 207–8 Quarto Catalogue, p. 554 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 56

ref.title: Manuscripts from German-Speaking Lands – A Polonsky Foundation Digitization Project

msItem.author: Conradus de Brundelsheim ('Soccus')
msItem.title: Sermones de tempore
msItem.note: Selection, frequently varying from the texts recorded by Schneyer; including some sermons not listed by Schneyer, but circulating with Soccus in other manuscripts; and with some additional sermons by other authors. Reference is made to the printed edition of 1480 (GW 7409; ISTC is00588000).

msItem.incipit: Ecce venio cito, et merces mea mecum est. In verbis istis propositis tria intelligimus, Dei videlicet legationem
msItem.note: Schneyer I.716–737, nos. 14, 15, 16, 17 (explicit differs), 20, 23, 25, 26.

msItem.incipit: Occurere mihi Deus sponsus uidens sponsam suam in sui preparacione
msItem.explicit: non sit finis desiderii in desiderando. Quod ipse prestare dignetur qui ad hoc desiderium misericorditer nos inflammet.
msItem.note: Also with Soccus, Sermones de tempore, in Stuttgart, Württembergische Landesbibliothek, Cod. theol. et phil. 2o 28

msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo luce ad prelatos et non socci qui lucas dicitur fore de ordine minorum
msItem.incipit: Curam illius habe Hec sunt verba samaritani ad stabulariam
msItem.note: Schneyer IV.61 (Lucas de Bitonto 158)
Part of fol. 16va blank; fol. 16vb blank.

msItem.incipit: Exurge a mortuis etc. Cogitanti mihi quod Deum Patrem
msItem.rubric: Sequitur prima dominica in aduentu Domini
msItem.incipit: (fol. 17v) Exurge in adiutorium mihi. Cum secundum Iacobum Omne datum
msItem.note: Soccus, nos. 1, 2, 3 (explicit differs), 5 (beginning at 'Si enim viam'), 29 (beginning at 'Notandum est quod a tribus exeundum est'), 7 (explicit differs), 12 (varied), 32 ('dominica secunda in aduentu', explicit differs), 33, 34 (ends as 36), 40 (ends as 41), 42, 43, 44 ('in circumcisione domini'), 48, 50, 52 (incipit differs), 53 (beginning at 'Sciendum est nobis quod v sunt genera nupciarum'), 56 (only the thema is given, fol. 41rb, followed by note 'quere in papiro in sermone Domine si vis potes me mundare et ista est dominica secunda'), 61 ('dominica tercia', explicit differs), 58 or 59 (thema only, 'quere eundeum sermonem in papiro sed abreuiatum')

msItem.incipit: Et ecce motus magnus In verbis prepositis tangitur medium temptacionis. Per hunc ergo ordinem

msItem.note: (fol. 43vb) 62 (beginning 'Ut ergo et vtamur verba beati Augustinus dicentis Sicut corpora propter algorem', and followed by the openings only of 65–67, 70, with references as above to a paper book), (fol. 44va) 73.
Fol. 45vb part blank; fol. 46r-v ruled, blank.

msItem.incipit: Extendens manum iesus In quibus verbis possumus deuo designare
msItem.note: 'Soccus' nos. 56 (explicit differs), 58 ('item de eodem', explicit differs), 65 ('de eodem'), 66, 67 (explicit differs), 70, 74 (explicit differs), 79 (varied, beginning at 'uerum cum cor nostrum'), 75 (ending at 'Pauli uocem hostia'; text continues on fol. 68).

msItem.incipit: Effunde sicut aqua Dicit Bernardus Si perfectionem quam desideratis non potes adipisci
msItem.note: 'Soccus', nos. 86 (incomplete, see below), 81, 82, 83, 84, 85, 86 (with cross-reference to the earlier incomplete copy), 87. Fols. 67v, 68ar-v frame-ruled, blank.

msItem.incipit: viua fiat. Hostia quippe
msItem.note: 'Soccus' nos. 75 (text continues from fol. 56vb), 100, 104 (explicit differs), 108 (beginning differs), 112, 113, 115, 116, 117, 123, 125, 126 (beginning differs)

msItem.incipit: Vespere comedetis Sciendum nobis est quod deus multa beneficia antiquis patribus in deserto existentibus corporaliter exhibuit
msItem.explicit: Hec beneficia nobis conferat Iesus Christus

msItem.note: 'Soccus', nos. 128, 129, 136 (incipit differs), 139 (explicit differs), 141 (explicit differs), 145 (abbreviated, begins 'Bonitas pastoris in tribus consistit'), 146, 150 (incipit differs), 151 (explicit differs), 155, 158, 160 (explicit differs), 159, 167 (explicit differs), 169, 172, 176 (explicit differs), 175.

msItem.incipit: Preparate corda vestra domino Sciendum quod sacram scripturam diligencius perlustrantes de corde exercificacione .vij. inuenimus ammoniciones
msItem.explicit: experienciam nos perducere dignetur iesus christus
msItem.note: Also in Innsbruck, ULBT, Cod. 216, fol. 125va, with Soccus.

msItem.incipit: Vidi in dextera sedentis in throno Et post pauca sequitur Et uidi et ecce in medio Johannes in hac visione tria nobis demonstrat. Primo personarum trinitatem describit
msItem.note: Also in Uppsala UB C 383 fol. 135v.

msItem.incipit: Gratia domini nostri iesu christi et caritas Nota quod beata trinitas totaliter se nobis exhibuit
msItem.explicit: quam perfectionem operetur in nobis trinus et unus. Amen.

msItem.incipit: O altitudo diuiciarum Festum sancte trinitatis quidam celebrant in dominica que est in octaua Penthecosten
msItem.note: Schneyer III.256 (Jacobus de Voragine 458)

msItem.incipit: Benedicat nos deus deus noster etc. Propheta spiritu sancto inspiratus
msItem.note: Schneyer III.256 (Jacobus de Voragine 459)

msItem.incipit: Hodie salus domui Nota quod domui zachei quadruplex salus facta fuit. Prima ex corporali christi presencia
msItem.note: Cf. Innsbruck, ULBT, Cod. 207, fol. 154vb; Cod. 764, fol. 358rb; Koblenz, Landeshauptarchiv, Best. 701 Nr. 138, fol. 24ra.

'Soccus' nos. 184, 186, 188 (explicit differs), 193 (explicit differs), 195 (begins 'in verbis propositis duo considerantur', as in the printed edition, and explicit differing from Schneyer's), 197, 204, 205 (varied).

msItem.incipit: Fidelis Deus qui non patietur nos temptari Dicit Gregorius Alta et incomprehensibilis gratia spiritus sancti cum luce sua mentes nostras irradiat
msItem.explicit: Beatus vir qui suffert temptacionem etc. Ad quam coronam nos perducat.
msItem.note: Cf. Melk, SB, Cod. 699, fol. 58va; Innsbruck, ULBT Cod. 584, fol. 131va, both with Soccus.

'Soccus', nos. 212 (explicit differs), 214, 219, 222, 226, 228 (beginning at 'apostolus qui per inhabitantem'), 230 (beginning 'In uerbo proposito est dicendum de uia religisorum que designata est per galylea', ending 'nos mundare dignetur...' as in the printed edition).

msItem.incipit: O uos omnes qui transitis Hec uerba dixit christus merite non solum ad discipulos sed ad omnes fideles
msItem.explicit: Nulla causam mortis invenio in homine isto ex hiis

msItem.incipit: Dum iret iesus In uerbis propositis moraliter intellectis ostenditur via ad uitam eternam
msItem.explicit: in maledictione erit Ps. via. A qua nos etc.
msItem.note: Cf. Melk, SB, Cod. 699, fol. 92v, with Soccus.

msItem.incipit: Confide fili remittuntur tibi peccata tua Verbum domini est ad paraliticum
msItem.note: Schneyer II.288 (Guibert of Tournai 72)

msItem.incipit: Multi enim sunt vocati Verbum hoc immo tocius ewangelii conclusio
msItem.note: Schneyer II.288 (Guibert of Tournai 73)
'Soccus', nos. 251, 255, 256 (explicit differs), 257.

msItem.incipit: Salvatorem expectamus Spes que differtur affligit animam, ideo apostolus nolens nos expectando deficere in verbis propositis consolatur nos tangens tria
Ambuletur digne deo Sicut wlgariter dicitur Quod vni placet alteri displicet
msItem.note: Schneyer II.489 (Guilelmus de Malliaco 81)

Rest of fol. 152va blank; fol. 152vb blank. Fol. 153r-v (a leaf from an earlier binding) blank except for a quotation from Ps.-Bernard (PL 184.504A) dated 1508: anno viijo nonas maiias Nec minus est mihi suspectus Iocus quma ira. Hec Berh.
Marginal note in German, fol. 130r.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns, 33–45 lines; ruled space 215–220 160

musicNotation.p: Fol. 129v, added notation in the lower margin.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2-line red and (from fol. 113) blue initials sometimes with simple decoration.

msItem.title: De septem donis Spiritus sancti.
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de septem donis Spiritus Sancti, et sequitur tractatus de x. preceptis
msItem.incipit: Oome datum optimum et omne donum perfectum desursum est descendens a patre luminum. Iacob primo. Sanctus Iacobus apostolus a ueritate paterni uerbi illuminatus
Hiis itaque generali in premissis modo de singulis donis in speciali
msItem.explicit: nec agi fructuosius aliquid potest, quam Deo gratias.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de septem donis Spiritus Sancti
msItem.note: Stegmüller, Bibl. 7520. Remainder of column blank, with rubric for following item at bottom.

msItem.title: De decem praeceptis
msItem.rubric: (fol. 191va) Incipit tractatus bonus de decem preceptis domini
msItem.incipit: Beatus homo quem tu erudieris et de lege tua docueris eum. Psalmus. Quia Dei precepta dirigunt ad superiora
msItem.explicit: Quod uinum nobis prestare dignetur, Qui et benedictus in secula seculorum. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus bonus de decem preceptis domini
msItem.note: Bloomfield 619 (attributed with query to 'Roland of Padua'); cf. Stegmüller, Bibl. 8414. Fols. 207rb blank; fols. 207v-208v blank.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns, c. 35–39 lines; ruled in ink. Ruled space 200–205 150–160

handDesc.handNote: More than one hand; fol. 154r, cursiva antiquior.

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Polonsky digitization project to include additional information from printed descriptions.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
